captions.text:
Let me tell you
why you're here.

You're here because
you know something.

What you know,
you can't explain,
But you feel it.

You've felt it
your entire life.

That there's something
wrong with the world.

You don't know what it is,
but it's there,

Like a splinter in your mind,
driving you mad.

It is this feeling
that has brought you to me.

Do you know what
I'm talking about?
The matrix?

Do you want to know
what it is?
The matrix is everywhere.
It is all around us.
Even now, in this very room.

You can see it when
you look out your window

Or when you turn on
your television.

You can feel it
when you go to work...
When you go to church...
When you pay your taxes.

It is the world that has been
pulled over your eyes
To blind you from the truth.
What truth?
That you are a slave, neo.

Like everyone else,
you were born into bondage,

Born into a prison that you
cannot smell or taste or touch.
A prison...For your mind.

Unfortunately, no one can
be told what the matrix is.

You have to see it
for yourself.
This is your last chance.

After this, there
is no turning back.
You take the blue pill,

The story ends,
you wake up in your bed,

And believe whatever
you want to believe.
You take the red pill,

title: Blue Pill or Red Pill - The Matrix (2/9) Movie CLIP (1999) HD

comments.text:
I'd take the blue pill I already went part way down the wabbit hole without 
a guide and managed to scurry my way back out again with my tail between my 
legs and my ears down!! Blue is the colour of divinity....all power goes 
round in a circle and people realize they cannot realistically govern 
themselves they will need guide's and guru's who have been vetted, help 
from the spiritually advanced and 'Angel's to help them on their life 
journey and that also involves politics because politics seeks to stabilize 
the world the Politicians themselves have to live in and manage. Still the 
Matrix was chosen by the people themselves who decided one day they 
preferred to shop in supermarkets and equip themselves with computerized 
gadgets as well as be part of a process which offers more choice and the 
more choice there is the more one thing can be connected to another in the 
same way an intricate spider web will connect from one strand to another.
Logically speaking there has to be some form of structure in a world which 
has developed it's forms of communication, Computer technology is only evil 
if it's used for evil purpose, otherwise it's a very admirable invention 
and makes many things a lot easier for people. It's a wonderful way to 
learn about the world around and read about history, to keep in contact 
with family and friends as well as a place to share thoughts and ideas.
Greeks and Romans developed the highest intellectual forms of early 
communication and they are still used to this day and have been expanded 
on.﻿

comments.text:
"Taking" the red pill is not a one time thing. It seems to visit us in 
mysterious ways, at uncertain times and often confronts and forces itself 
on ego. We deny it, run from it, resist it, vehemently fight it. . . but 
once it seeps into the mind it permeates and affects our thinking like 
nothing else. A foundation of seeking and searching for "truth" was laid. A 
chaotic, yet beautiful journey has long begun.

I think it's not so much about the destination and its unfolding 
"outcomes". . . for what if the destination and all that it entails IS the 
journey? Come what may from the red pill, let's enjoy the ride.﻿

comments.author: Mattm1986

comments.text:
This defining short scene from The Matrix (1999) is layered with 
philosophical significance. Neo’s conscious decision to swallow the red 
pill brings enlightenment and abandonment from the Marxist notion of ‘false 
consciousness’. Additionally, the sentiment behind Rousseau’s contention 
that “man was born free, and everywhere he is in chains” is illustrated by 
Morpheus’ wisdom that ‘The Matrix’ is “the world that has been pulled over 
your eyes to blind you to the truth”. The persistent illusion of a 
fabricated reality, described as a “prison for your mind”, has a strong 
resonance with modern Capitalism and religion as an “opiate for the 
masses”. In conjunction with Marx and Rousseau, Plato’s ‘Allegory of the 
Cave’ and mistaking appearance for reality is also metaphorically invoked. 
The illusion and irony behind the notion of utopia and dystopia is also 
highlighted throughout the film, and alludes to influential literature of 
the 20th century such as 1984, Brave New World and The Hand Maid’s Tale. 
For example, it is only a dystopia from a human perspective, which has been 
philosophically and conceptually explored throughout the history of the 
science fiction genre. For the thinking man’s film critic, The Matrix is a 
film that challenges your perception of modern society and free will. It is 
fair to say that the Wachowski brothers definitely did their best work with 
this classic, and despite the bitterly disappointing sequels, re-defining 
the science fiction genre of filmmaking is no mean feat and certainly needs 
to be celebrated. So, with that in mind…follow the white rabbit. ﻿
comments.author: Jack Casey

comments.text:
+Jack Casey Beyond being a societal commentary it is also a challenge to 
our sensory experience and our very sense of reality. We are reaching a 
point in modern physics and cosmology where it becomes obvious that what we 
perceive through our senses is a universal illusion of sorts. This is 
alluded to in Plato's allegory of the cave. The prisoners can never see 
anything but the 2 dimensional shadows of 3 dimensional objects. With the 
advent of Einstein's 4 dimensional paradigm we must start to wonder whether 
it is not ourselves who are the ones imprisoned in a 3 dimensional "cave" 
we call "the world." Yes, follow the white rabbit ...
comments.author: Prisoners of Space & Time

comments.text:
Oh, for Pete's sake...not the 9/11 drivel. Ok...First off, you need to 
learn the difference between 'your' and 'you're' before you ATTEMPT to 
insult someone's intelligence. That's basic elementary English. Second, why 
would the steel from the the WTC need to melt in order for the buildings to 
collapse? That's idiotic. If the steel is weakned by fire and by a plane 
crashing into it, then the structure will fail as it can no longer bare the 
weight for which it was designed. If you feel that's "impossible" 
then...ok. There's no convincing you of anything because you aren't 
following logic and I'm definitely not about to go around in circles with 
you on that. It'll be in vain. 

I'll give you a point for not believing in that satanic illuminati 
nonsense, though. Apparently, you aren't THAT gullible. 

As far as believing everything I see in the media, I never said that nor 
infered that. But you, being the typical conspiracy loon, assume so. You 
all, literally, say the same thing when someone doesn't believe the 
bullshit that some rock dweller put on a biased blog site or threw together 
to create a YT vid. 

Does the government tell us, the people at the bottom, everything? OF 
COURSE NOT! I don't have to believe in conspiracies to know that. That's 
the nature of the game in ANY heirachy situation. W/E company you work for, 
the people on top do not tell those of you at the bottom eveything, 
although their decisions affect you. They tell you want they want you to 
know. The government is the same way. Do you fools think that you're 
special because you "discovered" that? Lol GTFOH. That's common sense.

But...hey...if it makes you all feel "smarter", "awake" and "aware" to 
believe what someone posted on a conspiracy website or a YT vid that is 
presented as fact but is nothing but claims, opinions and 
speculation...knock yourselves out. 

Again...have a nice day. •FIN•

comments.author: mrkiky

comments.text: I'm a solipsist. I live in the Matrix, alone. ﻿
comments.author: Pinkie Pie

comments.text:
+mrkiky 
My desires don't affect my simulated reality. I've been placed here in this 
dream or simulation by entities, who I'd assume just want to test me. Or 
reality just spontaneously came into existence, and I'm the only sentient 
being. Either way, I'm not the one who dicates what happens. The only thing 
I can do is change it through direct physical input. When I said "I'm 
technically god", I wasn't referring to the classical dictator god. I'm 
more like the entity that allows reality to exist through its own existence 
by processing it, regardless of its wills or desires.
comments.author: Pinkie Pie

comments.text: +Pinkie Pie So, you're not even god of your own mind.
comments.author: mrkiky

comments.text:
+mrkiky 
So?
comments.author: Pinkie Pie

comments.text: +Pinkie Pie Yet stuff that you don't want still happens.
comments.author: mrkiky

comments.text:
+mrkiky 
Everything is connected to everything, and everything is the cause of 
everything (according to Chaos Theory.) So yes, I can indirectly control 
you conciously. Every single one of my actions, even the mere act of 
thinking about the words that I'm typing right here, will have an indirect 
or direct affect on you. Also, in order for anything to "exist", it must 
pass through MY senses, and be processed through MY brain. Things exist 
because my existence allow them to, so I'm technically god.
comments.author: Pinkie Pie

comments.text:
+Pinkie Pie You can consciously experience me, but not control me! And yes, 
obviously figuratively suck. And because it would be cooler to have at 
least a little more power than your other projections.
comments.author: mrkiky

comments.text:
+mrkiky 
Subconscious? Not really. I still experience you conciously. And I'm not 
sure what you mean by "suck". Figuratively suck? Literally suck? And to 
what extent? Relative to what? Also, why MUST it suck?
comments.author: Pinkie Pie

comments.text:
I'm a subconscious part of your mind telling you it must suck to not be God 
in your own world.
